revised_title: Combustion Dynamics of Fuel Droplets in High-Speed Oxidant Streams
tldr: The article investigates the burning of a fuel droplet in a high-speed oxidant stream, focusing on the release and transport of heat and mass. The authors analyze the problem by dividing it into four regions and solving the governing equations. The results show that the flame zone is close to the droplet surface, and the droplet experiences a thrust due to the release of mass, which can lead to drag reduction in practical situations.
scientific_discipline: Engineering and Technology > Fluid Dynamics and Combustion
